task_summary: The robot pours the contents from a cup into a mug using visual perception, approach, alignment, pouring, and retreat phases.

task_long_description.overview: A manipulator equipped with a gripper holds a cup containing liquid and pours it into a target mug. The robot first localizes the mug and the cup, approaches and aligns above the mug, tilts the cup to pour, then returns to a neutral position. The workspace is a tabletop with the mug centrally positioned and the robot operating from above.
preconditions: Cup contains liquid and is grasped by the robot
Mug is present at a known or detectable location
stepwise_plan: Detect the target mug via vision
Move above and align over the mug
Execute pour action from cup into mug
success_criteria: Liquid is successfully transferred from the cup into the mug
No spillage on the table or outside the mug
failure_and_recovery: If mug not visible, scan up to 3 times
If pour incomplete, prompt operator intervention
task_long_description.termination: The tree terminates when pouring and retreat are complete or an unrecoverable error occurs.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the cup is visible to the perception system.
Scans area to locate the cup with a raster pattern.
Runs object detection to localize the cup precisely.
Moves end-effector above the cup at a set offset height.
Approaches and aligns gripper above the cup with precision.
Executes pouring action from the cup into the mug.
Waits momentarily to confirm task completion.

recovery_strategy: Rescan for mug if not visible up to 3 attempts
Abort on repeated failures and alert operator
assumptions: Instruction does not specify pour amountâ€”defaulted to 'full'.
Frames confirm objects: 'cup' is source, 'mug' is target.
If the cup was already in gripper at episode start, grasping phase omitted.
No visible spillage events in frames.

expected_success_criteria: Pour completed with liquid transferred to mug.
